main event: A civilian driver of an oil truck in Baudette, Minnesota observed a bright white, basketball-shaped object that appeared to fall straight down and disappear instantaneously in 1960.
interesting points: The object was observed for only one second.
The object was reported to have a slight trail and no sound.
Weather conditions were clear and good at the time of the sighting.
The object was observed straight west of Baudette, Minnesota.
The sighting was evaluated as a credible unidentified flying object.
witnesses: a civilian driver of an oil truck
